Message: Hi, Iâ€™m the NewsBreak Ad Assistant. How can I help?
The user completes the submission of the form
Hi do we have an AM
Hi Trevor! We don't have dedicated account managers (AM) for every advertiser. However, I'm here to help with any questions or issues you might have. Let me know what you need assistance with!
Is there an auto insurance lead list available ?I usually ask AM's

Hi Trevor! We don't provide specific lead lists, including auto insurance leads. However, you can create targeted ad campaigns to reach your desired audience. If you need help setting up a campaign or have any other questions, feel free to ask!
I need to set up day parting (M-F 8a-9p ET) but I don't see an option to choose a time zone. What time does does this use

Hi Trevor! The ad manager uses Pacific Standard Time (PST) for scheduling. So, if you want to set up day parting for M-F 8a-9p ET, you'll need to convert those times to PST. For example, 8 AM ET is 5 AM PST and 9 PM ET is 6 PM PST.
If I have 4 ads in my adset, and I cut 2 ads, will it reset the learning phase?

Making significant changes to your ad set, such as cutting 2 out of 4 ads, can potentially impact the learning phase. The learning phase is when the system is analyzing performance signals to optimize your campaign. It's generally recommended to avoid major adjustments during this time to prevent disrupting the process. If you need more detailed guidance, you might want to check out our Newsbreak Ads Overview for more insights on managing your ad sets effectively.
I'm running video ads, does adding in the ad image increase performance? I currently don't have any ad images in my campaigns

It's a good idea to test different types of creative assets in your campaigns. Adding image ads alongside your video ads can help you reach a broader audience and potentially improve performance. However, it's recommended to separate video and image assets into different ad sets for better optimization. You can find more detailed best practices in our tCPA Best Practices article.
Sorry I meant Poster image - does that increase performance

Adding a poster image to your video ads can help improve performance by providing a visually appealing thumbnail that can attract more viewers. It's always a good idea to test different elements in your ads to see what works best for your audience. If you need more detailed guidance, you might want to check out our Ad Creative Best Practices and A/B Testing article.
I use CPV Pro to track all of my newbreak stats - for some reason the Cost isn't being passed over, how can I fix?

Let's get that sorted out for you! To ensure that the cost data is being passed correctly to CPV Pro, you'll need to check your postback URL settings. Here's a step-by-step guide on how to integrate Newsbreak with CPV Pro and ensure cost data is included:
1. Log in to your CPV Pro account.
2. Navigate to the 'Postback URL' section in your tracking settings.
3. Make sure you have included the correct parameters for cost data in your postback URL.
4. The parameter for cost should be set as `&cost={cost}` or similar, depending on CPV Pro's requirements.
5. Save your changes and test the integration to ensure that cost data is being passed correctly.
For more detailed instructions, you can refer to our article on integrating a Newsbreak Postback with CPV One, which has similar steps: [How to integrate a Newsbreak Postback with CPV One](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/34188623183757-How-to-integrate-a-Newsbreak-Postback-with-CPV-One).
is lotto allowed on newsbreak?

Sweepstakes are generally not allowed on NewsBreak. I recommend checking out our policy document for detailed guidelines on sweepstakes. You can find it here: Sweepstakes Policy. Let me know if you have any other questions!
So you said generally not allowed, meaning it's allowed sometimes?

I understand the confusion. Sweepstakes are typically not allowed on NewsBreak. However, for specific details and any exceptions, I recommend reviewing our policy document thoroughly. You can find it here: Sweepstakes Policy. If you have any other questions or need further clarification, feel free to ask!
Thank you for sending but the link didn't send, it's unclickable

I apologize for that. Here is the link to the Sweepstakes Policy document: [Sweepstakes Policy](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/30691198502541-How-to-integrate-a-Newsbreak-Postback-with-the-Cake-Platform). Let me know if you have any other questions!
Ty!
You're welcome! If you need any more help, feel free to ask!
Hey my campaign stopped spending , any idea what's wrong

I'm sorry to hear that your campaign stopped spending. Could you please provide more details? For example, is your account new and not yet verified, or have you received any notifications about your campaign status? This will help me assist you better.
No notifications, account is not new, we have 1 campaign live with 1 adset and 1 ad, could it because we only have 1 ad live?

Thanks for the details! Having only one ad live shouldn't necessarily stop your campaign from spending. Here are a few things you can check to troubleshoot the issue:
1. **Launch Date and Time**: Ensure that the launch date and time at the ad set level are correct. Remember, Ad Manager uses PST/military time, so double-check if your campaign is set to start at a later time.
2. **Budget Adjustments**: If you've recently made changes to your budget, it might affect performance. During the learning phase, it's suggested not to make too many changes and increase the budget by no more than 50% every 2-3 days.
3. **Payment Method**: Verify that you have a valid payment method associated with your account, even if you are using ad credits.
If none of these seem to be the issue, I recommend reaching out to our support team at adsupport@newsbreak.com for further assistance.
You can also refer to this article for more information: [Billing Guide](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/17821681919757-Billing-Guide).
Let me know if you need any more help!
If my adset is marked as "learning progress slow" will that make my ad camapign not spend?

If your ad set is marked as 'learning progress slow,' it can affect the performance and spending of your campaign. During the learning phase, it's normal to see fluctuations in performance. Here are a few tips to improve the learning progress:
1. **Increase Budget Gradually**: Avoid making drastic changes to your budget. Increase it by no more than 50% every 2-3 days.
2. **Add More Creatives**: Consider adding more creatives to your ad set. Testing 3-5 ads per ad set is recommended, especially if your budget is below $200.
3. **Review Targeting and Bidding Strategy**: Adjust your targeting and bidding strategy if necessary.
4. **Monitor Performance Weekly**: Since our model optimizes with a 7-day average CPA goal, review weekly performance to make adjustments.
For more detailed information, you can refer to this article: [Reporting Guide](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/18088532505485-Reporting-Guide).
If you need further assistance, feel free to reach out!
